Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator 2 x, plus 3, and denominator x plus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements are true?
The graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a horizontal asymptote at <math alttext="y equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="the limit as x approaches infinity, of, f of x, equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a horizontal asymptote at <math alttext="y equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="the limit as x approaches, negative infinity, of, f of x, equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a vertical asymptote at <math alttext="x equals, negative 1 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></math> because <math alttext="the limit as x approaches, negative 1 from the right, of, f of x, equals infinity" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.
